nodes.bodyText: This is wrapped in Angular, so I can either 1) condition what content is shown within the file on the feature flag, or 2) branch what route we go to based on the feature flag in a few different places. I started out working on 1), but it would be relatively easy to switch to 2) if you, esteemed reviewer, think it would be cleaner.
I like this approach, unless we think there is some need to display the v2 DUA for some reason after launching the v3 DUA.
nit: line continuation indent here and throughout. I'm surprised tslint doesn't care about this.
Why invoke this via call rather than just invoking the function normally? If this is necessary, please add a comment to explain why.
This is preexisting - this was what was in the render function before I started this implementation. I'd prefer not to spend effort refactoring code that we have an open ticket to delete.

I'd probably use V3 in the flag name instead of V2. Should hopefully be an easy search/replace. This line illustrates why the current naming could be confusing.
Alternatively: If the intent was to convey "v2" of the DUA implementation, perhaps something like enablePdfDataUser.... would be appropriate.
